2025-01-01.history: Celebrates Mary’s divine maternity as Mother of Jesus, the Prince of Peace.

2025-01-02.saint: Sts. Basil the Great and Gregory Nazianzen
2025-01-02.history: Fourth-century bishops and Doctors of the Church, known for defending orthodoxy.

2025-01-03.history: Devotion to the holy name of Jesus emphasizes His saving power.

2025-01-04.history: First native-born American saint, founder of the Sisters of Charity.

2025-01-05.history: Celebrates Christ revealed to the nations, symbolized by the visit of the Magi.

2025-01-06.history: Canadian brother known for his humility and devotion to St. Joseph.

2025-01-07.history: Dominican priest, patron of canon lawyers.

2025-01-12.history: Marks the end of the Christmas season; Jesus is revealed as Son of God.

2025-01-13.history: Fourth-century bishop and Doctor of the Church, defender against Arianism.

2025-01-20.saint: St. Fabian, Pope and Martyr; St. Sebastian
2025-01-20.history: Fabian was a pope and martyr; Sebastian, a Roman soldier martyred for Christ.

2025-01-21.history: Young Roman martyr, model of purity and courage.

2025-01-22.saint: Day of Prayer for the Legal Protection of Unborn Children (USA)
2025-01-22.history: A day of penance and prayer for the unborn.

2025-01-23.saint: St. Vincent, Deacon and Martyr; St. Marianne Cope
2025-01-23.history: Vincent was a Spanish martyr; Marianne served lepers in Hawaii.

2025-01-24.history: Bishop and Doctor, known for his gentleness and spiritual writings.

2025-01-25.history: Celebrates Paul’s dramatic conversion on the road to Damascus.

2025-01-26.history: Also observed as Sunday of the Word of God.

2025-01-27.history: Founder of the Ursulines, dedicated to the education of girls.

2025-01-28.history: Dominican priest and Doctor of the Church, one of the greatest theologians.

2025-01-31.history: Priest, educator, and founder of the Salesians.

2025-08-01.history: Bishop and Doctor of the Church, founder of the Redemptorists.

2025-08-02.saint: St. Eusebius of Vercelli; St. Peter Julian Eymard
2025-08-02.history: Eusebius was a bishop and defender of the faith; Eymard founded the Blessed Sacrament Congregation.

2025-08-03.history: Ordinary Time continues, focusing on Christ’s ministry.

2025-08-04.history: Patron saint of parish priests, known as the Curé of Ars.

2025-08-05.saint: Dedication of the Basilica of St. Mary Major
2025-08-05.history: First church in the West dedicated to Our Lady.

2025-08-06.history: Jesus revealed His glory on Mount Tabor before Peter, James, and John.

2025-08-07.saint: St. Sixtus II and Companions, Martyrs; St. Cajetan
2025-08-07.history: Sixtus was a pope martyred with companions; Cajetan founded the Theatines.

2025-08-08.history: Founder of the Order of Preachers (Dominicans).

2025-08-09.saint: St. Teresa Benedicta of the Cross (Edith Stein)
2025-08-09.history: Carmelite nun and martyr of Auschwitz.

2025-08-10.history: Deacon and martyr of Rome, known for his charity.

2025-08-11.history: Follower of St. Francis, founder of the Poor Clares.

2025-08-12.history: Founder of the Visitation Order with St. Francis de Sales.

2025-08-13.history: Pope Pontian and priest Hippolytus reconciled before martyrdom.

2025-08-14.history: Franciscan priest who gave his life in Auschwitz.

2025-08-15.saint: Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-08-15.history: Mary was assumed body and soul into heavenly glory.

2025-08-16.history: First king of Hungary, brought Christianity to his people.

2025-08-17.history: Ordinary Time continues, focusing on faith and perseverance.

2025-08-19.history: Priest and promoter of devotion to the Sacred and Immaculate Hearts.

2025-08-20.history: Cistercian abbot and Doctor of the Church.

2025-08-21.history: Pope known for liturgical reforms and promoting frequent Communion.

2025-08-22.saint: Queenship of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-08-22.history: Celebrates Mary as Queen of Heaven and Earth.

2025-08-23.history: First canonized saint of the Americas.

2025-08-24.history: One of the Twelve Apostles, traditionally martyred for his faith.

2025-08-25.history: Louis IX, king of France; Calasanz founded the Piarists.

2025-08-27.history: Mother of St. Augustine, known for her perseverance in prayer.

2025-08-28.history: Bishop and Doctor of the Church.

2025-08-29.saint: Passion of St. John the Baptist
2025-08-29.history: Beheaded for speaking truth to power.
